title.narrative: ENABLING ENVIRONMENT FOR LEARNING, CHILD PARTICIPATION AND PREVENTION OF VIOLENCE

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, through the Programme Component â€œEducation, Protection and Adolescent Development", children, adolescent and youth, boys and girls learn, acquire the academic and social skills necessary for their optimal development and are protected from all forms of violence and abuse.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: New Element

description.narrative: UNICEF supported Education counterparts to developAction Plan (2021-2025) for prevention of and response to gender-based violence in schools and online. In addition,assessment tools have been developed in the frame of foundational numeracy and literacy skills initiative for primary school students. Evidence have been generated about child trafficking and children living in streets, and the assessment of the implementation since 2015 of the integrated child protection system. The development of multisectoral strategy for Adolescent’s development will allow the country to get a national framework and coordination mechanisms to address in holistic manner issues facing children aged 10-18 years old | Status:Met | As-of Date:02/02/2022
